title: Cat. 86  Fragment of a Cup, late 1st century B.C./1st century A.D.
publication_title: Roman Art at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Fragment of a Cup  
Late 1st century B.C./1st century A.D.  
Roman  
Glass, mosaic glass technique; 2.8 × 2.1 × 0.8 cm (3/4 × 7/8 × 3/8 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Theodore W. and Frances S. Robinson, 1949.1236

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">Translucent amethyst, aquamarine, and opaque white and red glass. Cup fragment fabricated by the mosaic glass technique, tooled, and polished. The fragment preserves a small segment of the outsplayed rim and double carinated profile. The mosaic pattern is formed from sections of a single cane in an amethyst ground outlined in white, each with a central white dot and a concentric red ring surrounded by a ring of ten yellow dots. Within the amethyst cross section are scattered transparent aquamarine dots.

Segment of rim preserved, three sides are broken, revealing dull edges and a dull exterior surface; the interior is repolished.  
Sidney Goldstein

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 86 Fragment of a Cup, late 1st century B.C./1st century A.D.

</section>
